data.additionalInfo:
The City Pass is valid for nine consecutive days (including the first day it is used). Tickets must be used within one year of the purchase date.

Please note that adults may be required present a form of ID at attractions.

Some attractions may require visitors to pass through security checkpoints. Please check entry instructions prior to arrival. 

If members of your group would like to visit attractions separately, please ensure each group member has a ticket with their name on it.

The City Pass includes admission to the Empire State Building and the American Museum of Natural History, plus admission to three of the following attractions: 
- Top of the Rock® Observation Deck
- General admission ferry access to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island
- Reserved ticket for one Statue City Cruises ferry ride to and from Liberty Island and Ellis Island, along with audio guides and admission to the Statue of Liberty Museum, Ellis Island Immigration Museum (Crown Tickets and Pedestal Access not included) and 9/11 Memorial & Museum.
- General admission for Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises 
- One regularly scheduled Landmarks Cruise, Liberty Midtown Cruise or Liberty Super Express Cruise (check circleline.com for current schedules) and admission to the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum.
- General admission to the Space Shuttle Pavilion, Submarine USS Growler and the film ‘Story of Intrepid’  
- General admission to the Guggenheim’s collection and special exhibits, plus a free digital guide (accessed via personal mobile device)

For the attractions where you have to choose only one or the other to visit, simply present your pass for scanning at your chosen attraction. Once scanned, you will not be able to visit the other attraction. For example, if you scan your pass at the Top of the Rock® Observation Deck, you cannot use it again at the Guggenheim Museum. 

Please print out your pass or present it on a mobile device at the various attractions. 

Please visit the City Pass website for entry instructions, reservation information and hours.

Please note that the 9/11 Memorial and Museum may be sold out due to high demand from visitors.

Please note that the Battery Park ticket office is located inside the Castle Clinton National Monument and the Liberty State Park ticket office is located inside the Central Railroad of New Jersey. Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises are located at Pier 83 - Midtown West 42nd St. and 12th Ave.

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book or be accompanied by an adult.
data.description:
With this New York City Pass, you’ll be able to explore the city’s main sights at your own pace. It is valid for nine consecutive days, so you can plan your itinerary at your convenience. 

The pass will include access to the Empire State Building and the American Museum of Natural History. You can also choose between a number of other attractions, including the Guggenheim, Ellis Island and the 9/11 Memorial and Museum.
data.name: New York CityPASS
restrictions: Visitors must show a valid photo ID.

reviews.content: Las atracciones que visitamos con el city pass, estuvieron excelentes. Fue sencillo de ingresar con los accesos digitales, había limpieza, buena atención, seguridad y una experiencia increíble con vistas hermosas desde el Empire State y Top of the Rock. El memorial, es un lugar que te hace retroceder en el tiempo y te hace recordar en qué lugar te encontrabas ese 9/11.
Booking the city pass was super easy would highly recommend great value
Parfait..facilite de réservation et d utilisation

Chance to save money and time and focus on the sights

attractionDetail.description: Elephanta Island was a powerful capital of coastal kingdom and today stands as magnificent relic rich in sculptural delights.This day-tour led by an expert guide is not to missed when visiting Mumbai.
attractionDetail.name: Elephanta Caves with Village tour.

reviews.content: I was disappointed with only two caves to visit. I thought there were more. Asked guide about Buddhist caves don't know if true but was told nothing to see in them. They just lived in then. The village was disappointing just a few house to see. But interesting information on the residents life's I got the chair ride up which is £20.Unless you have lots difficult with stairs there are large areas of flat ground between the stairs so plenty time to get breath back. I wouldn't waste money. Lots of opportunities for buying food drinks and memento.
Finding the meeting place was difficult and very crowded but that might be partially due to weekend crowds.

whatsIncluded: *Non Private option:For a group of 4 and above Monument entry fees would be included.
Monument entree fees- For Private tour option only.
Pick-up & drop by private car from your door step (IF option is selected)
*In NON Private option : For group of 4 and above pick-up would be provided from your door step.

attractionDetail.description:
Enjoy a 3 hour fun, entertaining & activity packed private tour in an operational Bollywood studio. This tour is special because it is the only Bollywood Tour in Mumbai which is owned & managed by an Actor & Director, Mr. Rahil Khan. Because of this you get an insiders perspective of the industry.

You get a unique experience of watching a live filming of a movie/series/television show from a close distance. You get an opportunity to interact with actors, actresses & crew members & take pictures with them.

You will enjoy watching a one hour live dance show and even participate in it!
(In a comfortable, air conditioned small auditorium)

You will visit the Bollywood mini museum and get to try out various costumes used in popular Bollywood movies. 

You will also visit the sound recording room in the studio & get an opportunity to sing & record your favorite song in any language!

After the studio tour, we take you to a nearby restaurant for a delicious lunch with our friendly guide.
attractionDetail.name: Best of Bollywood Private Tour with Lunch and Transport.

reviews.content: Thank you for the great time

attractionDetail.additionalInfo:

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

guestPickup.instructions:
Please note that a pickup service is available from hotels located between Dadar and Colaba.

If your hotel is located outside the listed pickup areas, pickup is available from a central meeting point close to your hotel.

Please enter your pickup details at checkout.

Please note that hotel pickup will commence before the scheduled tour time.

Please contact the tour provider to arrange your pickup details. You'll find their contact details on the ticket you'll receive after booking.

attractionDetail.description:
This tour will give you the chance to travel around Mumbai after sunset and discover the city’s famous attractions from a local perspective.

After pickup, you’ll first head to the Gateway of India and Dhobi Ghat and take a ride along the coastal Marine Drive. You’ll be able to explore historical landmarks like the High Court of Bombay, the Prince of Wales Museum of Western India and Flora Fountain. Besides, you’ll have the opportunity to see the Girgaon Chowpatty beach, the Banganga Tank and Mumbai University.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Night Tour
restrictions: Children under 18 years old must be accompanied by an adult.

reviews.content: We did this tour on our first night which gave us an idea where things were for the next day. Our guide and driver were great. Very informative. Thank you to them both.
Excellent guide
Mumbai am Abend ist sehenswert und interessant. Auf unsere individuellen Wünsche wurde ganz selbstverständlich eingegangen. Empfehlenswert.
Our guide was Alam and he was amazing! The tour lasted over 3 hours! We visited so many places and Alam’s knowledge and English were brilliant. He even took us on a train ride. Would 100% recommend!
My guide Nani was a very jovial person and I really enjoyed the tour.
Thoroughly enjoyed this evening tour . Mumbai was beautifully lit up, the locals were out enjoying themselves and my guide Maze was fun and informative
It was a quick 2 hours tour , although not worth the money for just 2 hours , but the guide was very patient and showed us all around and explained very well in English.

attractionDetail.shortDescription: A night-time tour to discover Mumbai's famous landmarks without chaos

attractionDetail.description:
This is a quintessential Itinerary which is hand crafted by the founder who also happens to born in the southern part of mumbai and knows the city inside out,
This sightseeing places included on this tour is almost perfect , There is a perfect blend of Historic/Cultural/Architectural/Modern sights that could be covered in the stipulated time frame and remains interesting throughout , And yes it has the ride in the most famous Local train of mumbai included before 3.00pm which is the highlight of the tour.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Private City Tour - With Local Train Ride

reviews.content: Not sure what 'local train ride' means in the title. I got what I signed up for: An informed guide with automobile tour of the city. Significant sites were pointed out in passing and sometimes with stops and a deeper dive. I had a short stay in Mumbai and my usual method of touring just wasn't going to work, so I booked this guided tour instead. It ggave me what I wanted in the timeframe I could manage. I was picked up promptly at my hotel by the guide and driver. The tour included a stop where I could buy a lunch. All in all a nice day out!

whatsIncluded: Get a chance to enjoy the local chai tea

reviews.content: The guide was nice and well prepared but the tour lasted half of the time, no lunch was included and 5out of 8 places hasn't been visited. I have received a refund (less then half of the cost) because l raised a complaint about it. Booking.com was fast and professional to deal with my request. Maybe there was a misunderstanding in between the local organisation and the guide but overall, unfortunately, the experience wasn't great, just potentially.

attractionDetail.description:
Get Ready to experience one of the amazing tours to Elephanta caves from Mumbai via a ferry ride.
• Visit the Elephanta Caves; a UNESCO World Heritage site, accessible from the 
 Gateway of India
• Learn about the 7 cave excavations at Elephanta, all carved from solid basalt 
 rock
• Discover the temples which honor the Hindu God Shiva and contain many 
 intricate sculptures
• A fun journey to the caves, learning about each of their features and the story 
 behind each one
• An English speaking guide will be available to help you with your tour
attractionDetail.name: Trip to Elephanta caves from Mumbai

reviews.content: Enthusiastic and friendly guide around caves with local resident of island, preceeded with helpful guide who organised all the travel arrangements, and pointed out the local attractions

attractionDetail.description:
Come experience Mumbai through food. It's time to have some delectable fun by partaking a food tour in the Fort area of Mumbai replete with History, Art, Culture and most importantly, some of the best food that the city has to offer. In our guided walking food tour lasting about 3 hours, you will taste foods from different parts of India and some local delicacies.
The cultural diversity of Mumbai can be seen in the culinary richness that the city offers in the form of street food with Muslim, Gujarati, South Indian, Parsi, and Maharashtrian influences. These flavors, colours, and textures create dishes that pop in your mouths without burdening your pockets.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Food Tour

reviews.content: We had a really great time on our food tour of Mumbai; we were introduced to so many foods that we would never have tried otherwise. We were stuffed with different foods till we had to call it a night. Kadir was very accommodating and met us and dropped us off where we wanted and took many photos with us. Chilli wimps should plan for even the mildest options still being spicy though, even with that my fiancee enjoyed all the food.

It was a complete waste of money. Did not get picked up from our location. Then met by a man on a scooter. Told him that Tour starts at Chowpatty Beach. Showed him itinerary. Took us to Beach and said we had to pay taxi!! Took us on beach. Then stopped at a stall to try some pani puri. I said when are we starting the Tour. He said ‘you wanted to come here’ I said yes to start the Tour as per itinerary, which was at the Fort area. We go to Fort and he says ‘do you want some pani puri. We said just had some. We tried a couple of other things. Then he said what else do you want. We said you are supposed to be showing us different foods of different cultures. He then said ‘ would you like a banana’. We eat bananas in the U.K. believe it or not. At that point we said take us back to the Hotel. He walked ahead of us the whole time. No interaction.

attractionDetail.additionalInfo:

attractionDetail.description:
On this guided day tour, you’ll get to discover some important highlights of Mumbai city. You’ll visit popular tourist spots such as Mani Bhavan, Dhobi Ghat, Jain temple, Banganga water tank and more. Then you’ll head to the Crawford Market, where you’ll have time to explore the variety of spices and other goods before visiting the iconic CST Station nearby.

Next, you’ll head to the Gateway Of India monument and later pass by the Mumbai High Court and University. You’ll also visit the Prince of Wales Museum and get insights into the history and heritage of the city. Finally, you can take a short train ride to experience the local life more closely.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Highlights Sightseeing Tour
restrictions: Require clothing to cover shoulders & knees. You may risk refused entry if you fail to comply with these dress requirements.
attractionDetail.shortDescription: A tour to visit and explore some of the most iconic landmarks in the city

For high – end luxury cars, please contact our office

attractionDetail.description:
Are you a first time traveler visiting the city of Mumbai? If yes then this tour is just for you. Covering 25 of the top tourist landmarks of Mumbai, this tour quite appropriately takes you through the highlights of colonial Mumbai, passing through the Victoria Terminus station, Kalaghoda art district and Gateway of India amongst others. We also take you on a cultural joy ride as we meet the Dabbawalas- the logistical wondermen who are known for precisely delivering 2,50,000 'dabbas' or tiffins, to their rightful owners, everyday. The tour also takes you through the Dhobighat- it has the power to make your jaw drop. It is an area where the laundrymen, more popularly known as the Dhobhis, wash the clothes of Mumbai-folks. You will see the Dhobhis at work, ﬂogging and beating the clothes tirelessly to ensure it is devoid of any stain.
To add more, we visit Mani Bhavan, which takes you through the historic journey of Gandhi and Mumbai.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Highlights: 25 must-sees as recommended by Gigi Hadid
notIncluded: Additional transport cost for pick-up from suburban Mumbai hotels
Additional cost for the services of a language guide (besides English)

attractionDetail.description: How did seven little islands turn into the mega-city of Mumbai? This 2-hour walk explores hidden histories and stories of the city; from the dark trade that built the city, to the gritty merchants who made and lost fortunes here. The walk takes you past iconic colonial-era buildings - from Gothic revival to Indo saracenic. You'll see what those architectural styles mean and uncover fascinating stories behind these magnificent structures. The walk starts near the Gateway of India and ends near Horniman circle.
attractionDetail.name: The Bombay Story Small Group Walking Tour in South Mumbai

attractionDetail.description: On this 6-hour private tour, you visit Includes Gateway of India. Dhobi Ghat, Hanging Garden, Mani Bhavan, Marine drive, Drive passes High Court, Prince of Wales Museum, Mumbai University, Flora fountain, Victoria terminus, Banganga tank. The idea behind the tour is for you to experience the city the way locals do and feel the real spirit of Mumbai.
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Private Full-Day Sightseeing Tour

attractionDetail.additionalInfo:
This tour is suitable for vegetarians and pescatarians. 

This tour is not suitable for participants with gluten intolerance, lactose intolerance or a vegan diet. 

This tour involves a moderate amount of walking. Comfortable shoes are recommended. 

This tour operates in all weather conditions. Please bring an umbrella if needed. 

Infant meals are not included.

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book or be accompanied by an adult.

arrival.address: Mohammed Ali Rd 130, Kalbadevi, Khokha Bazar
arrival.instructions: The tour will conclude along the famous Mohammed Ali Road. Your guide will be able to help you find transportation home or give you walking directions.

departure.address: Residency Hotel Fort, Mumbai, Citibank, DN Road, Fort
departure.instructions: Meet your guide outside the entrance of the Residency Hotel located in the Fort area of Mumbai. Your guide will be wearing an ‘A Chef’s Tour’ t-shirt.

attractionDetail.description:
On this small-group tour, you’ll go on tasting adventure of the city’s local and delicious foods designed by a chef. Throughout the journey, you’ll ride the city’s transportation system like the famous commuter line to get around three different districts. The exploration will take you through old markets and you’ll hear stories about the region. 

Along the way, you’ll be treated to 15 or more snacks and dishes throughout the city’s various areas. During the tour, you’ll try curries with crispy papads, chaat snacks, kebabs and hand-churned ice cream using the location’s original method from the 19th-century. Other tasting highlights will include kheema with freshly baked bread, puri drenched in yoghurt and chai at one of the city’s last remaining Persian cafés.
healthSafety: Requires a moderate level of physical fitness
attractionDetail.name: Small-Group Local Food Tour
restrictions: Children under 18 years old must be accompanied by an adult.

reviews.content: Street food can be risky anywhere, especially India. I waited 48 hrs to be sure 😹. Poonja was great and if we wanted to try something extra or different, there was no hesitation. I highly recommend this, beware there is LOTS of food so pace yourself.
とても楽しいツアーでした。 ガイドさんも親切で、良い経験になりました。 炭焼きトースト、ドーサが特に美味しかったです！途中、電車にも乗れたり、盛り沢山な内容のツアーで、おススメです。

Intresting tour. I clould ask about diffrent thing to learn abour the culture Some time bit fast tour, running from one place ro another. To much food, but everyting very tastfull. The concept is grate.

Really a fun, new small group experience for an older, well traveled couple from US. Highly recommend it. Food was delicious. Total immersion into south Mumbai street scene. Will do it again in other cities. Our guide was a young woman named Pooja. She helped make the night memorable and fun. The meeting point, a small hotel in the Fort area, was a little difficult to find due to surrounding street construction so build in a little extra time to arrive.

Ceci n’a rien d’une visite gastronomique, c’est tout au plus une tournée des gargotes de rue. Un chef ne peut absolument pas avoir conçu ce genre de choses. Tout est très épicé, et le premier site a présenté un poisson dur comme de la semelle. Très déçue De plus, beaucoup trop de bla-bla, fait par une guide touristique et absolument pas par un chef

The guide Pooja(?) was excellent and did her very best but the organization of the tour was poor. We were having to almost run to keep up and at one point almost lost sight of the guide because the crossing lights changed. We are over 60 but we can all walk well but can’t run. This rushing spoiled it for us and we left the tour before the end. I stress this was not the guide’s fault but the way it was organized.The last restaurant had no toilet, we rushed there, then waited outside, then waited inside, and the food was not anything special. Please slow the tour down, fewer places would make it enjoyable. We had no time to even look up at the beautiful buildings or to take stock of our whereabouts.I would not recommend this and I feel sad that I wasted my money. If the walking had been a little slower we would have finished the tour but we could not continue to almost jog to Crawford Market. We all wore trainers or walking sandals so footwear was not the problem.

attractionDetail.description:
The Kanheri Caves are a group of 109 Caves and Rock-Cut Monuments in the lush green Forest of the National Park in the western outskirts of Mumbai. 

They contain Buddhist sculptures dating from the 1st century BCE. 
This site is on a beautiful hillside and a secret hidden treasure of Mumbai. 

The caves contain Buddhist sculptures and relief carvings, paintings and inscriptions.

Most of the caves were Buddhist viharas, meant for living, studying, and meditating. There are Buddhist sculptures, reliefs, pillars and rock-cut stupas. establishment of Buddhist monks.
attractionDetail.name: Kanheri Caves and Sanjay Gandhi National Park
whatsIncluded: English speaking, friendly knowledgeable knowledgeable and helpful guide, Lunch and Transport is included.

attractionDetail.description: Learn about traditional spices and Indian cooking techniques at a local family’s home in Mumbai. Discover the culture and cuisine inside an Indian kitchen and learn how to prepare classic dishes, such as Rajma (Kidney beans), Choley (Chikpeas), and chapatis,you learn to cook Indian food without animal products using creative alternatives in a private  vegan cooking class.
attractionDetail.name: Vegetarian or vegan Cooking class .

reviews.content: Mr Rahul was an excellent guide and host. He knows the local sites and history well; and speaks fluent English. We toured several sites before going to the chef’s home for cooking class and lunch. The chef and the young man who interpreted for her were very kind. I was provided with tea upon arriving. A simple meal was made, something that you would cook every day. Spices and ingredients were explained, tasted, smelled etc… the meal was excellent and the roti was delicious ( I had several).., I enjoyed this very much and in addition to learning a little more about cooking with vegetarian food; you get to see and experience life in an actual home.

whatsIncluded: Transport by private air condition vehicle

accessibility: Infants must sit on an adult's lap

arrival.address: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya, MG Road 159-161, Fort

Starting point instructions are available after downloading.

attractionDetail.description:
On this self-guided tour, you'll have the opportunity to visit Mumbai's historic buildings and sites through a downloadable audio guide. After downloading the app, you'll be led to sites that exemplify the city's Victorian Gothic and Art Deco architecture. At the Oval Maiden, you'll view both architectural styles in close proximity. Some of the other sites you'll visit include the Flora Fountain, Rajabai Clock Tower, Elphinstone College and David Sassoon Library. The tour ends at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Museum.

Throughout the audio guide tour, you'll learn about the history of the sites and the culture of Mumbai. As you visit sites, you can pause and restart the self-guided tour at any time, allowing you to explore at your own pace.
attractionDetail.name: Downloadable App & Self-Guided Architectural Tour

reviews.content: I enjoyed Historical buildings in Mumbai. At the beginning of the station, I lost a little but I got used to enjoy this tour. As a cinema building was under rennovation, it was difficult to be aware of it. However, generally I could enjoy the tour. This was second day for me. I thought I should have done the tour at the first day because I understand about not only buildings but also history of Mumbai and India.

attractionDetail.shortDescription: Audio guide tour to explore historic buildings and sites with a downloadable app
whatsIncluded: Downloadable audio guide for your mobile device
Offline access to audio, maps and geodata

guestPickup.instructions:
Please note that pickup is available from hotels in Mumbai. 

Please enter your pickup details at checkout. 

Please note that hotel pickups will commence ten minutes before the scheduled tour time.

attractionDetail.description:
On this tour, you will be able to see the highlights of the buzzing metropolis that is Mumbai. Once you get picked up from your hotel, you will visit the iconic Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, a railway station that is not only a UNESCO World Heritage Site but a representation of Victorian Gothic architecture. 

Next, you will take a ride in a local taxi to see the Gateway of India and snap some great pictures. From here, you will be able to drive through Marine Drive to reach Babulnath, a 200-year-old Shiva Temple. After a brief stop, you will head to Haji Ali, an iconic mosque in the heart of Mumbai. 

At the end of the tour, you will visit the Dhobi Ghat to see how tons of clothing gets washed, ironed and returned in Mumbai. Once the tour ends, you will be dropped back at your hotel.
healthSafety: Not recommended for visitors with back problems
Not recommended for visitors with heart problems or serious medical conditions
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Highlights Tour
attractionDetail.shortDescription: A four-hour tour to see the most prominent attractions in Mumbai

attractionDetail.additionalInfo:
Children aged 0–2 years can join for free if they don’t occupy their own seat.

A group of up to three people will be accommodated in a car like Toyota Etios, Maruti Swift Dzire or a similar vehicle. A group of up to five people will be accommodated in a van like Toyota Innova or a similar vehicle. 

It is recommended to wear closed shoes, long pants and long-sleeved shirts or a scarf to cover the shoulders.

The tour timings are 08:00–16:00.

Please note that the itinerary may change depending on the pickup location.

Please bring your ticket with you to the attraction.

Be aware that operators may cancel for unforeseen reasons.

You need to be 18 years or older to book or be accompanied by an adult.

guestPickup.address: Kanheri Caves Excursion + Mumbai City Tour

attractionDetail.description:
On this tour, you'll get to explore the Kanheri Caves and South Bombay along with a local guide.

After being picked up from your hotel, you'll be driven to the Kanheri Caves where you'll get a chance to see over a hundred ancient rock-cut monuments and Buddhist temples. You'll then head to South Bombay, where you'll see some of the city's most famous landmarks, such as the Gateway of India, the Taj Mahal Palace Hotel and the UNESCO-listed Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus – a historic railway station featuring Victorian Gothic Revival architecture. Other stops will include the sprawling Crawford Market, Mahatma Gandhi's former residence and the Haji Ali Dargah, an iconic Islamic mosque.

For views of the city, you'll head to Malabar Hill, after which you can take in the skyline and the 'Queen's Necklace' at the sea-facing Marine Drive.
attractionDetail.name: Guided City Tour with Kanheri Caves Visit

reviews.content: The tour operator Mr. Leroy Dmello was very efficient communicating with me on WhatsApp to make sure the tour run as smoothly as possible. We had a wonderful time. Mr. Fahad the driver picked us up from our hotel on time. He was a very good driver. I requested to him to play some Indian music and he quickly obliged. Alam the first tour guide for the Kanheri caves was very nice to us was very patient when we were taking pictures and even took some of our group pictures for us. he was very knowledgeable. The second half which was the city tour was By Mr Pawan but he preferred to be called Maze. Maze was also knowledgeable and made our tour very interesting. He also helped us to take group photos, he became our personal photographer with excellent humour. Lunch was also provided which was Indian cuisine at its best. Overall we had a very good time and were very physically exhausted after the tour. Which was a good thing because we ended up in the pool and steam room at the hotel. Over all we had a 5 star treat.

attractionDetail.shortDescription: Eight-hour tour of Mumbai's highlights with views of the sea and skyline

departure.instructions: Meet your guide in front of Grandmama’s Cafe, nearby Dadar East railway station big bridge, at the listed address.

attractionDetail.description:
This private tour will take you to explore Mumbai's culinary scene with a foodie guide that will introduce you to the flavours of the city. The tour will also allow you to see some of the major tourist attractions along the way.

After meeting your guide at Grandmama's Cafe, you'll start the tour by tasting a Batata Vada – a famous potato snack served with bread. The tour will continue with different stops at family restaurants and street stalls to eat a selection of delicacies, including Thaalipeeth, Paneer, coconut water, Khadi Vada or Kheemauna. 

You'll also have the opportunity to see how some of these dishes are made and learn about the influence of other cultures on Mumbai's cuisine.To finish on a sweet note, you'll sample a Boondi Ladoo with a cup of fresh filter coffee.
attractionDetail.name: Private Street Food Tour with Ten Tastings
attractionDetail.shortDescription: A guided tour to get to know Mumbai's culinary scene

attractionDetail.description:
India, the cradle of civilization, the land of multiple religions. Zoom in a bit and you spot Mumbai - a cosmopolitan urban city with a zeal unmatched anywhere else in the country. Yet in all the rushing of the city, there are plenty of places which offer you peace and serenity.
We undertake a tour to all the major shrines of religions in the city!
attractionDetail.name: Mumbai Spiritual Tour

reviews.content: Sorry but the guide did not really tell us much and everywhere he took us we were not allowed to enter and eventually we asked him to rather take us back to the hotel as it was really a waist of money and time
